intro: Baccaurea parviflora, commonly known as the small-flowered baccaurea, is a tropical plant native to Southeast Asia. It is a climbing shrub that produces small, white flowers and edible, fleshy berries. The plant belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its palmate leaves and smooth, cylindrical stems. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. The berries are typically consumed fresh or used in local cuisines.
